name: 4-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-2-butanone
Reason: 4-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-2-butanone has a basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The functional groups present in this molecule include a hydroxyl group, a methoxy group, and a carbonyl group. The hydroxyl group can increase the melting point by around +5°C due to the additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The methoxy group can also contribute to the melting point by around +5°C due to the additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The carbonyl group can form hydrogen bonds and contribute around +20°C to the melting point.
